Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2019 07:22AM Whirlaway wrote: Mine was 90%. TN. Tumor grew to solid 6 x 3 cm in less than 2 months. I am almost 3 years out now. Had partial mastectomy (with reconstruction). I was shocked too when I found out. I searched back then and found a few more with high KI 67, 2 with 90, one with 95 one with 100 %, if I remember correctly. They were two years ahead of me back then which I found reassuring! I hope everyone is still doing well! BTW, my onc. nor surgeon ever commented on it.  Wishing you best of luck!! I know it is so scary in the beginning.
Posts.Title: High Ki-67 survivors!? Caitpow88 Kjchico

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2018 01:11PM Whirlaway wrote: I found the DD A/C tough. The weekly (12) Taxol were much easier! I am now a year+ post treatment and I feel almost like my old self! Hang in there!! Stay hydrated and rest lots
Posts.Title: Anyone feel awful on last AC? find taxol easier? Help pls dlittkemann Whirlaway

Posts.Content: May 30, 2017 12:22PM Whirlaway wrote: I actually had that happen too. I always was/am on a healthy, high fiber diet and had no problems during chemo but two weeks into rads that changed. I think in my case, part of it had to do with the position they put me in during radiation. I have osteoarthritis on L3/L4 (lower back) from an accident years ago. I just think I got a bit 'misaligned' with all that 'fidgeting' they did to get me in the right position. I have been seeing an osteopath for my old injury for years and she said that I felt especially stiff after radiation and it is getting better now. The other part was possible the long drive every day -  1 h each day - and change of my meal schedule as I had different appt. each day. It is hard on your body not to have healthy rhythm. Two more weeks and then you are done. Hang in there and best wishes!
Posts.Title: Radiation treatment and constipation? Emilie88 Whirlaway
